com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.client

Interface Sender


  • public interface Sender
    This interface is the bridge between Server and Client.

    The ClientStart aggregates this Object and exposes it via ClientStart.send().

    It can be used to:

    • send Objects to the Server, so that the CommunicationRegistration of the Server handles it
    • register to a certain type of message
    • unregister from a certain type of message

    The reset Method should not be used within production. Reset clears out all saved instances of requested registrations and therefore is after calling it not able to resolve register responses.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • objectToServer

        ReceiveOrSendSynchronization objectToServer(Object o)
        Sends an Object over the network to the server.

        The call will result in an asynchronous extraction. However, it returns a synchronization mechanism, that will allow the developer to listen for a successful send or incoming messages.

        It uses the DefaultConnection

        Parameters:
        o - the Object that should be send over the network.
        Returns:
        a synchronization mechanism to allow procedural programming

      • objectToServer

        ReceiveOrSendSynchronization objectToServer(Object o,
                                            Connection connection)
        Sends an Object over the network to the server.

        The call will result in an asynchronous extraction. However, it returns a synchronization mechanism, that will allow the developer to listen for a successful send or incoming messages.

        It uses the specified Connection.

        Parameters:
        o - the Object that should be send over the network.
        connection - the Connection that should be used.
        Returns:
        an synchronization mechanism to allow procedural programming

      • objectToServer

        ReceiveOrSendSynchronization objectToServer(Object o,
                                            Class connectionKey)
        Sends an Object over the network to the server.

        The call will result in an asynchronous extraction. However, it returns a synchronization mechanism, that will allow the developer to listen for a successful send or incoming messages.

        It uses the Connection, identified by the provided key.

        Parameters:
        o - the Object that should be send over the network.
        connectionKey - the identifier of the Connection that should be used
        Returns:
        an synchronization mechanism to allow procedural programming

      • registrationToServer

        <T> ReceiveOrSendSynchronization registrationToServer(Class<T> clazz,
                                                      CacheObserver<T> observer)
        Sends a register request to the Server. If successful, the Server will update the Client every time, the requested Object is updated

        The call will result in an asynchronous extraction. However, it returns a synchronization mechanism, that will allow the developer to listen for a successful send or incoming messages.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the message, you want to register to
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of the message, you want to register to
        observer - the callback object, that should be called, if an Object of the specified type arrives
        Returns:
        a synchronization mechanism

      • registrationToServer

        <T> ReceiveOrSendSynchronization registrationToServer(Class<T> clazz,
                                                      CacheObserver<T> observer,
                                                      Connection connection)
        Sends a register request to the Server. If successful, the Server will update the Client every time, the requested Object is updated

        The call will result in an asynchronous extraction. However, it returns a synchronization mechanism, that will allow the developer to listen for a successful send or incoming messages.

        Uses the provided Connection.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the message, you want to register to
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of the message, you want to register to
        observer - the callback object, that should be called, if an Object of the specified type arrives
        connection - the Connection that should be used.
        Returns:
        a synchronization mechanism

      • registrationToServer

        <T> ReceiveOrSendSynchronization registrationToServer(Class<T> clazz,
                                                      CacheObserver<T> observer,
                                                      Class connectionKey)
        Sends a register request to the Server. If successful, the Server will update the Client every time, the requested Object is updated

        The call will result in an asynchronous extraction. However, it returns an synchronization mechanism, that will allow te developer to listen for a successful send or incoming messages.

        Uses the Connection, identified with the provided connectionKey

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the message, you want to register to
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of the message, you want to register to
        observer - the callback object, that should be called, if an Object of the specified type arrives
        connectionKey - the key for the Connection that should be used.
        Returns:
        a synchronization mechanism

        Returns:

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the Sender to its original state.

        Calling this Method is not recommended. It is utilized, to reset a Client, once it disconnects from the Server, to allow it to reconnect. It cleans out all internal saved instances

        Calling this Method results in a clean of all requested registration and there corresponding callback Objects. So if you send an register Request and shortly after call this method, the callback Object will no longer be available.

        This method is called if the last Connection is disconnected.
